title: Topic 001 Question 308
body: A company has a core application that must run 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The application uses Amazon EC2. AWS Fargate, and AWS Lambda. The company uses a combination of operating systems across different AWS Regions.
The company needs to maximize cost savings while committing to a pricing model that offers flexibility to make changes.
What should the company do to meet these requirements?
options: Purchase a Compute Savings Plan that is based on Savings Plans recommendations
Purchase an EC2 Instance Savings Plan that covers the EC2 instance types and the Fargate and Lambda vCPU equivalents.
Purchase a Reserved Instance for the instance types, operating systems, Region, and tenancy,
Use EC2 Spot Instances that match the type and size of existing instances that run in each Region.
